content: I do not have any personal opinions, but in general, modern koreans view dragons more as cultural symbols and artistic motifs rather than literal creatures with supernatural powers. however, the dragons still hold a special place in korean culture and are considered an important part of the country's artistic and historical heritage. they are often featured in art, literature, and popular culture, and the dragon dance is a traditional korean dance commonly performed during festivals and special occasions. so, while the belief in the power of dragons may not be widespread in contemporary korea, their influence on korean culture is still strongly felt.
